channel.title: CVE Feed for nimeshrmr -- WP Private Content Plus
channel.description: The latest CVEs for nimeshrmr -- WP Private Content Plus

item.title: CVE-2021-4385|2024-08-03T17:23:10.745Z -- nimeshrmr -- wp%20private%20content%20plus
item.description: The WP Private Content Plus plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 3.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the save_groups() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add new group members via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-0680|2024-06-04T17:58:52.286Z -- nimeshrmr -- wp%20private%20content%20plus
item.description: The WP Private Content Plus plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 3.6. This is due to the plugin not properly restricting access to posts via the REST API when a page has been made private. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to view protected posts.

item.title: CVE-2024-0680|2024-08-01T18:11:35.683Z -- nimeshrmr -- wp%20private%20content%20plus
item.description: The WP Private Content Plus plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 3.6. This is due to the plugin not properly restricting access to posts via the REST API when a page has been made private. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to view protected posts.
